meanings.definition: Low-lying vegetation, such as shrubs and bushes, that grows beneath the canopy of a forest.
meanings.sent1: The hikers had to push through the thick underbrushes to reach the hidden waterfall.
meanings.sent2: The forest ranger warned us to watch out for snakes hiding in the underbrushes.
meanings.sent3: The playful squirrel darted in and out of the underbrushes, playing hide-and-seek with the other animals.
meanings.sent4: The underbrushes whispered secrets to the passing breeze, their leaves rustling softly.
meanings.sent5: The underbrushes teemed with life, from tiny insects to colorful birds hopping around.

meanings.definition: To clear or remove the underbrush from an area.
meanings.sent1: The workers underbrushed the overgrown trail to make it accessible for hikers.
meanings.sent2: Before building the new cabin, they needed to underbrush the land to create space.
meanings.sent3: The gardener underbrushes the garden every spring, making sure the flowers have room to bloom.
meanings.sent4: She underbrushed her mind of clutter, focusing only on the present moment.
meanings.sent5: The community came together to underbrush the park, creating a safe space for children to play.
